snippet: Mississippi officials hope a publicly operated civil rights museum scheduled to open in 2017 will be a symbol that the state is reckoning with the ugliest parts of its history.
abstract: Mississippi Civil Rights Museum will be first state-operated civil rights museum in country when it opens in 2017, and officials hope that it will be symbol that Mississippi is reckoning with ugliest parts of its history; for residents who were once beaten by state officials, whose oppression was state policy, handing over personal relics to become part of its official history is loaded decision.
lead_paragraph: Mississippi officials hope a publicly operated civil rights museum scheduled to open in 2017 will be a symbol that the state is reckoning with the ugliest parts of its history.

headline.main: Civil Rights Sins, Curated by One of the Sinners
